Title: 1. Jaws
Description: When a massive killer shark unleashes chaos on a beach community off Long Island, it's up to a local sheriff, a marine biologist, and an old seafarer to hunt the beast down.
filming_locations: ["Water Street, Edgartown, Martha's Vineyard, Massachusetts, USA"]

Title: 2. The Rocky Horror Picture Show
Description: A newly-engaged couple have a breakdown in an isolated area and must seek shelter at the bizarre residence of Dr. Frank-n-Furter.
filming_locations: ['Oakley Court, Windsor Road, Oakley Green, Windsor, Berkshire, England, UK']

Title: 3. One Flew Over the Cuckoo's Nest
Description: In the Fall of 1963, a Korean War veteran and criminal pleads insanity and is admitted to a mental institution, where he rallies up the scared patients against the tyrannical nurse.
filming_locations: ['Oregon State Mental Hospital - 2600 Center Street NE, Salem, Oregon, USA']

Title: 4. Dog Day Afternoon
Description: Three amateur robbers plan to hold up a Brooklyn bank. A nice, simple robbery: Walk in, take the money, and run. Unfortunately, the supposedly uncomplicated heist suddenly becomes a bizarre nightmare as everything that could go wrong does.
filming_locations: ['285 Prospect Park West, Brooklyn, New York City, New York, USA']

Title: 5. Shampoo
Description: On Election Day, 1968, irresponsible hairdresser and ladies' man George Roundy is too busy cutting hair and dealing with his girlfriends and mistress Felicia Karpf, whose husband Lester is having an affair with his ex-girlfriend Jackie.
filming_locations: ['2270 Bowmont Drive, Beverly Hills, California, USA']

Title: 6. The Return of the Pink Panther
Description: Inspector Jacques Clouseau is put on the case when the Pink Panther diamond is stolen, with the Phantom's trademark glove the only clue.

Title: 7. Funny Lady
Description: Story of singer Fanny Brice's stormy relationship with showman Billy Rose.

Title: 8. The Apple Dumpling Gang
Description: Three orphan children strike gold in 1878 California.

Title: 9. Tommy
Description: A psychosomatically blind, deaf, and mute boy becomes a master pinball player and, subsequently, the figurehead of a cult.
filming_locations: ['Kings Theatre, 20-24 Albert Road, Southsea, Portsmouth, Hampshire, England, UK']

Title: 10. Three Days of the Condor
Description: A bookish CIA researcher in Manhattan finds all his co-workers dead, and must outwit those responsible until he figures out who he can really trust.
filming_locations: ['55 East 77th Street, Manhattan, New York City, New York, USA']

Title: 11. Lucky Lady
Description: A trio of rum-runners during prohibition in the 1930s engage in a menage-a-trois after business hours.

Title: 12. The Great Waldo Pepper
Description: After WW1, an ex-pilot takes up barn-storming and chance-meets a former German ace fighter pilot with whom he co-stars in Hollywood war movies depicting aerial dog-fights.

Title: 13. Love and Death
Description: In czarist Russia, a neurotic soldier and his distant cousin formulate a plot to assassinate Napoleon.
production_companies: ['Jack Rollins & Charles H. Joffe Productions', 'United Artists']

Title: 14. Escape to Witch Mountain
Description: Two mysterious orphan children have extraordinary powers and are chased by a scheming millionaire. But where do these kids really call home?

Title: 15. Once Is Not Enough
Description: A young woman goes home to New York after a long stay in Europe. Her former schoolmate introduces her to the decadence of New York and she ultimately falls in love with an older man who's a stand-in for her father, before tragedy strikes.

Title: 16. The Eiger Sanction
Description: Classical art professor and collector Dr. Jonathan Hemlock, who doubles as a professional assassin, is coerced out of retirement to avenge the murder of an old friend.

Title: 17. French Connection II
Description: "Popeye" Doyle travels to Marseille to find Alain Charnier, the drug smuggler who eluded him in New York.

Title: 18. The Smurfs and the Magic Flute
Description: A villain named McCreep steals the Smurfs' magic flute, an instrument that makes people dance wildly, and uses it to rob them. The Smurf King sends out Peewit to track down the thief and retrieve the flute.

Title: 19. Give 'em Hell, Harry!
Description: One-man show about the presidency of Harry S. Truman.

Title: 20. Nashville
Description: Over the course of a few hectic days, numerous interrelated people prepare for a political convention.

Title: 21. Bug
Description: An earthquake releases a strain of mutant cockroaches with the ability to start fires, which proceed to cause destructive chaos in a small town. The studies carried out by scientist James Parmiter, however, reveal an intent with much more far-reaching consequences.

Title: 22. Monty Python and the Holy Grail
Description: King Arthur and his Knights of the Round Table embark on a surreal, low-budget search for the Holy Grail, encountering many, very silly obstacles.
filming_locations: ['Castle Stalker, Appin, Argyll and Bute, Scotland, UK']
production_companies: ['Python (Monty) Pictures', 'Michael White Productions', 'National Film Trustee Company']

Title: 23. Framed
Description: A gambler kills a sheriff in self defense. But as everyone in conspiring against him, he is condemned to a long sentence in prison.

Title: 24. At Long Last Love
Description: Four socialite old friends unexpectedly clash, and switch partners during a party and attempt to make each other jealous.

Title: 25. The Passenger
Description: Unable to find the war he's been asked to cover, a frustrated war correspondent takes the risky path of co-opting the identity of a dead arms-deal acquaintance.

Title: 26. The Giant Spider Invasion
Description: Giant spiders from another dimension invade Wisconsin.
filming_locations: ['University of Wisconsin-Stevens Point, 2100 Main Street, Stevens Point, Wisconsin, USA']

Title: 27. Picnic at Hanging Rock
Description: During a rural summer picnic, a few students and a teacher from an Australian girls' school vanish without a trace. Their absence frustrates and haunts the people left behind.
filming_locations: ['Mount Diogenes, Hanging Rock Reserve, Woodend, Victoria, Australia']
production_companies: ['British Empire Films Australia', 'The South Australian Film Corporation', 'The Australian Film Commission']

Title: 28. Switchblade Sisters
Description: The leader of an inner-city girl gang is challenged when a new girl moves into the neighborhood.
filming_locations: ['Moonlight Rollerway - 5110 San Fernando Road, Glendale, California, USA']

Title: 29. Grey Gardens
Description: Meet a mother and daughter, high-society dropouts, reclusive cousins of Jackie O., managing to thrive together amid the decay and disorder of their East Hampton, NY, mansion, making for an eerily ramshackle echo of the American Camelot.
stars: ['Edith Bouvier Beale', "Edith 'Little Edie' Bouvier Beale", 'Brooks Hyers']
filming_locations: ['East Hampton, Long Island, New York, USA']

Title: 30. Mirror
Description: A dying man in his forties remembers his past. His childhood, his mother, the war, personal moments and things that tell of the recent history of all the Russian nation.

Title: 31. That Most Important Thing: Love
Description: Servais Mont, a photographer, meets Nadine Chevalier who earns her money starring in cheap soft-core movies. Trying to help her, he borrows the money from the loan sharks to finance the theatrical production of 'Richard III' and gives Nadine a part. Nadine is torn apart between Servais, for whom she is falling in love, and her husband Jacques, to whom she has moral obligations.

Title: 32. Seven Beauties
Description: The defense of honor, a strong value in Neapolitan society, and its effects on the life of everyman Pasquale Frafuso.

Title: 33. Fox and His Friends
Description: A suggestible working-class innocent wins the lottery but lets himself be taken advantage of by his bourgeois new boyfriend and his circle of materialistic friends.

Title: 34. Mother Kusters Goes to Heaven
Description: Frau Kusters is preparing dinner late one seemingly-ordinary afternoon in her seemingly-ordinary kitchen in Frankfurt, Germany. She wants to add canned sausages to the stew; her annoying daughter-in-law thinks otherwise. But the point is moot: Mr. Kusters has murdered the personnel director at the soap factory where he works--and followed that by committing suicide.

Title: 35. The Story of Adele H
Description: The story of Adèle Hugo's unrequited love for a lieutenant.
production_companies: ['Les Artistes Associés', 'Les Films du Carrosse', 'Les Productions Artistes Associés']

Title: 36. Salò, or the 120 Days of Sodom
Description: In World War II Italy, four fascist libertines round up nine adolescent boys and girls and subject them to 120 days of torture.

Title: 37. Barry Lyndon
Description: An Irish rogue wins the heart of a rich widow and assumes her dead husband's aristocratic position in 18th-century England.

Title: 38. Night Moves
Description: Los Angeles private investigator Harry Moseby is hired by a client to find her runaway teenage daughter. Moseby tracks the daughter down, only to stumble upon something much more intriguing and sinister.

Title: 39. The Wind and the Lion
Description: A Berber chieftain triggers an international incident, drawing the involvement of Theodore Roosevelt, when he kidnaps an American widow and her children in 1900s Morocco.
genres: ['Action Epic', 'Adventure Epic', 'Desert Adventure', 'Epic', 'One-Person Army Action', 'Period Drama', 'Political Drama', 'Swashbuckler', 'Action', 'Adventure']
filming_locations: ['Plaza of the Americas, Sevilla, Andalucía, Spain']

Title: 40. Death Race 2000
Description: In a dystopian future, a cross country automobile race requires contestants to run down innocent pedestrians to gain points that are tallied based on each kill's brutality.
filming_locations: ['Chet Holifield Federal Building - 24000 Avila Road, Laguna Niguel, California, USA']

Title: 41. The Story of O
Description: A photographer is introduced to the world of dominance and submission.

Title: 42. Supervixens
Description: A hapless gas station attendant evades arrest by the psychopathic cop who murdered his unfaithful wife, and encounters a bevy of busty babes until he meets his ideal woman.

Title: 43. Jeanne Dielman, 23, quai du commerce, 1080 Bruxelles
Description: A lonely widowed housewife does her daily chores, takes care of her apartment where she lives with her teenage son, and turns the occasional trick to make ends meet, but something happens that changes her safe routine.
production_companies: ['Paradise Films', 'Unité Trois', 'Ministère de la Culture Française de Belgique']

Title: 44. The Stepford Wives
Description: Joanna Eberhart has come to the quaint little town of Stepford, Connecticut with her family, but soon discovers there lies a sinister truth in the all too perfect behavior of the female residents.
filming_locations: ['Lockwood-Mathews Mansion - 295 West Avenue, Norwalk, Connecticut, USA']

Title: 45. The Man Who Would Be King
Description: In 1880s India, two former British soldiers decide to set themselves up as Kings in Kafiristan, a land where no white man has set foot since Alexander the Great.

Title: 46. The Beast
Description: In order to inherit a fortune a young woman agrees to marry a young man. She soon discovers that his family harbours a dark past involving a monstrous beast.

Title: 47. Rollerball
Description: In a corporate-controlled future, an ultra-violent sport known as Rollerball represents the world, and one of its powerful athletes is out to defy those who want him out of the game.

Title: 48. Deep Red
Description: A jazz pianist and a wisecracking journalist are pulled into a complex web of mystery after the former witnesses the brutal murder of a psychic.
filming_locations: ['Villa Scott, Corso Giovanni Lanza 57, Turin, Piedmont, Italy']

Title: 49. Mandingo
Description: An 1840s slaveowner trains one of his slaves to be a bare-knuckle fighter.
filming_locations: ['Houmas House Plantation - 40136 Highway 942, Burnside, Louisiana, USA']

Title: 50. Black Emanuelle
Description: While on assignment in Nairobi, a photojournalist questions her racial and sexual identity when she engages in affairs with her wealthy hosts.
production_companies: ['San Nicola Produzione Cinematografica', 'Flaminia Produzioni Cinematografiche', 'Emaus Films S.A.']

Title: 51. A Boy and His Dog
Description: In a post-apocalyptic wasteland, a boy who can communicate with his dog telepathically is targeted by a mysterious committee.

Title: 52. Robin Hood Junior
Description: Robin Hood Junior helps Maid Marion to escape from her wicked uncle.

Title: 53. Shivers
Description: The residents of a suburban high-rise apartment building are infected by parasites that turn them into mindless nymphomaniac fiends.
filming_locations: ['200 Rue de Gaspé, Île-des-Soeurs, Montréal, Québec, Canada']
production_companies: ['Cinépix Film Properties (CFP)', 'DAL Productions', 'Canadian Film Development Corporation (CFDC)']

Title: 54. Out of Season
Description: Ann and Joanna, a mother-daughter duo, run a hotel on an island. When they receive an unexpected guest, Joe, who had an affair with Ann years ago, Joanna express her feelings for him.

Title: 55. Breakheart Pass
Description: John Deakin is being transported, as a prisoner, on a train with supplies and medicine to Fort Humboldt, Nevada.

Title: 56. Strip Nude for Your Killer
Description: After a model dies during an abortion, a figure wearing a motorcycle helmet murders her doctor, then targets models and photographers from the agency she belonged to.

Title: 57. The Killer Elite
Description: Mike Locken, who works for a private security firm affiliated with the C.I.A., is betrayed by his partner and left apparently crippled for life.

Title: 58. Ilsa: She Wolf of the SS
Description: Ilsa is an evil Nazi warden at a death camp that conducts "medical experiments." Ilsa's goal is to prove women can withstand more pain and suffering than men, and therefore should be allowed to fight on the front lines.
filming_locations: ['Cinema General Studios - 846 N. Cahuenga, Hollywood, Los Angeles, California, USA']

Title: 59. Cooley High
Description: In 1964 on Chicago's Near-North Side, the lives of four carefree high school seniors and best friends, including an aspiring playwright and an all-city basketball champion, takes a tragic turn.
filming_locations: ['Cabrini-Green Public Housing Projects, Near North Side, Chicago, Illinois, USA']
production_companies: ['American International Pictures (AIP)', 'Cooley High Services Company', 'Steve Krantz Productions']

Title: 60. Hard Times
Description: The saga of a drifter who turns to illicit bare-knuckle boxing in Depression-era New Orleans.

Title: 61. Dersu Uzala
Description: The Russian army sends an explorer on an expedition to the snowy Siberian wilderness where he makes friends with a seasoned local hunter.

Title: 62. Farewell, My Lovely
Description: Los Angeles private eye Philip Marlowe is hired by paroled convict Moose Malloy to find his girlfriend Velma, former seedy nightclub dancer.
filming_locations: ['1024 S. Grand Avenue, Downtown, Los Angeles, California, USA']

Title: 63. The Man in the Glass Booth
Description: Mossad agents kidnap an American Jewish man, accuse him of being a fugitive Nazi war criminal and take him to Jerusalem to face trial for genocide.
production_companies: ['The Ely Landau Organization Inc.', 'Cinévision Ltée', 'The American Film Theatre']

Title: 64. Inserts
Description: A young, once-great Hollywood film director refuses to accept changing times during the early 1930s, and confines himself to his decaying mansion to make silent porn flicks.
filming_locations: ['Lee International Studios, Kensal Road, Kensal Town, London, England, UK']

Title: 65. Hester Street
Description: In 1896, a Russian Jewish woman immigrates to New York's Lower East Side to reunite with her Americanized husband, but has difficulty assimilating.
filming_locations: ['Bleecker Street, Manhattan, New York City, New York, USA']

Title: 66. Tarzoon: Shame of the Jungle
Description: Shame, the ape man of the jungle, sets off to rescue his woman, June, when a gang of giant penises kidnaps her.
production_companies: ['Société Nouvelle de Doublage SND', 'Valisa Films Prod.']

Title: 67. The Day of the Locust
Description: An art director in the 1930s falls in love and attempts to make a young woman an actress despite Hollywood who wants nothing to do with her because of her problems with an estranged man and her alcoholic father.
filming_locations: ['Ennis House - 2607 Glendower Avenue, Los Feliz, Los Angeles, California, USA']

Title: 68. Snuff
Description: A so-called "snuff" film involving the exploits of a cult leader leading a gang of bikers in a series of supposedly real killings on film.

Title: 69. The Other Side of the Mountain
Description: Young ski champion Jill Kinmont is left paralyzed after a tragic skiing accident. Her best friend suffers the same fate after contracting polio. Jill must slowly put her life back together again with the help of those close to her.

Title: 70. Carry on Behind
Description: Two professors visit an archaeological dig near a caravan park. Amidst eccentric characters and sexual humor, the caravan site sinks, leading to a striptease performance instead of the planned cabaret.
filming_locations: ['Bad Godesberg Way, Maidenhead, Berkshire, England, UK']

Title: 71. Last Stop on the Night Train
Description: A pair of psychotic hoodlums and an equally demented nymphomaniac woman terrorize two young girls on a train trip from Germany to Italy.

Title: 72. Confessions of a Pop Performer
Description: The continued erotic adventures of a British boy trying to make money and meet ladies, this time as a member of a pop band.

Title: 73. Brannigan
Description: Chicago Police Lieutenant Jim Brannigan is sent to the U.K. to escort organized crime boss Ben Larkin back to the U.S., but Larkin's hitmen prepare an ambush for Brannigan.
filming_locations: ["RAC Club, 89-91 Pall Mall, St James's, Westminster, Greater London, England, UK"]

Title: 74. Playing with Fire
Description: A man whose girl is threatened to be kidnapped sends her for protection with a private detective. He takes her to a mansion, where many kidnapped girls waiting to be ransomed are drugged and subjugated to all kinds of sexual depravities.
filming_locations: ['Rue de Tilsitt, Paris, Ile de France, France']

Title: 75. The Drowning Pool
Description: Harper's a big-city PI, who travels to Louisiana to help an old girlfriend who's worried her husband will find out she's been cheating on him.

Title: 76. Leave Us Alone
Description: Danish teens steal boat, sail to uninhabited island. Boat disappears, leaving them stranded. Holiday turns nightmarish with peer pressure, violence, and accidents.

Title: 77. Strange Love of the Vampires
Description: In a 19th century village, a young aristocrat suffering from a terminal disease finds herself being drawn to the underground world of vampires and their strange rituals.

Title: 78. Smile
Description: A social comedy about a beauty pageant for young Californian women, held annually in Santa Rosa, and how it affects the locals and participants.
production_companies: ['Tamalpais Productions', 'David V. Picker Productions', 'Twin Roads Productions']

Title: 79. Sholay
Description: After his family is murdered by a notorious and ruthless bandit, a former police officer enlists the services of two outlaws to capture the bandit.

Title: 80. Lisztomania
Description: Composer and pianist Franz Liszt (Roger Daltrey) attempts to overcome his hedonistic life-style while repeatedly being drawn back into it by the many women in his life and fellow composer Richard Wagner (Paul Nicholas).
filming_locations: ['New Wimbledon Theatre, The Broadway, Wimbledon, London, England, UK']

Title: 81. Linda Lovelace for President
Description: Follows Linda Lovelace's fictional grass roots campaign to run for president.

Title: 82. The School Teacher
Description: Edwige Fenech plays the sexy private teacher of Franco (Alfredo Pea) who immediately falls madly in love with her. Franco tries and tries to seduce her by faking his own suicide.

Title: 83. Dolemite
Description: After he is released from jail, a pimp takes on the criminals and corrupt police officers who framed him in the first place.
filming_locations: ['Dunbar Hotel - 4225 S. Central Avenue, Los Angeles, California, USA']

Title: 84. Bite the Bullet
Description: A pair of ex-Rough Riders, a former prostitute, a gunfighter, an aging cowboy and an English gentleman enter a 700-mile horse race through the Southwest desert in 1908.
filming_locations: ['White Sands National Monument, New Mexico, USA']

Title: 85. The Family Vice
Description: Dying industrialist's family competes for inheritance through deceit. Ex-convict butler hired by half-sister undermines wife, pretends homosexuality. Women try seducing him. Twist reveals power dynamics after industrialist's death.
filming_locations: ['Incir De Paolis Studios, Rome, Lazio, Italy']

Title: 86. The Devil's Rain
Description: A satanist cult leader is burnt alive by the local church. He vows to come back to hunt down and enslave every descendant of his congregation, by the power of the book of blood contracts, in which they sold their souls to the devil.

Title: 87. Rosebud
Description: Renowned producer-director Otto Preminger captures international terrorism in this film about five teenage girls who are kidnapped from a yacht by the P.L.O. Stars Peter O'Toole and Richard Attenborough.

Title: 88. So Young, So Lovely, So Vicious...
Description: Angela is not happy about her daddy's choice for a new wife and does everything she can to destroy her stepmother-to-be.

Title: 89. The Adventures of the Wilderness Family
Description: The Robinson family decide to leave city life behind for one of clean living in the wilderness for the sake of their daughter's health. There they learn the value of family as they become closer to nature.

Title: 90. Rooster Cogburn
Description: Marshal Rooster Cogburn unwillingly teams up with Eula Goodnight to track down her father's murderers.

Title: 91. The Ups and Downs of a Handyman
Description: The sexually frustrated women of Sodding Chipbury lead a humdrum existence, until Bob, the handsome new handyman, arrives in their picturesque village.

Title: 92. Race with the Devil
Description: Two couples vacationing together in an R.V. from Texas to Colorado are terrorized after they witness a murder during a Satanic ritual.

Title: 93. The Chaos Class
Description: Lazy, uneducated students share a very close bond. They live together in the dormitory, where they plan their latest pranks. When a new headmaster arrives, the students naturally try to overthrow him. A comic war of nitwits follows.

Title: 94. The Adventure of Sherlock Holmes' Smarter Brother
Description: The younger brother of the consulting detective tries to steal Sherlock's glory by solving an important case assisted by an eccentric Scotland Yard detective and a lovely but suspicious actress.

Title: 95. Zorro
Description: In the New World, a new Spanish governor finds the province of Nueva Aragón under the iron fist of the corrupt Colonel Huerta and vows to bring justice under the guise of a masked avenger.

Title: 96. The Return of the Exorcist
Description: A priest becomes involved in demonology and exorcisms.

Title: 97. Friday Foster
Description: While investigating a plot to assassinate politicians, magazine photographer Friday Foster becomes a target herself.
filming_locations: ['Richelieu Apartments - 751 South Normandie Avenue, Los Angeles, California, USA']

Title: 98. The Olsen Gang on the Track
Description: After the Olsen Gang's money is stolen in Spain, Egon is arrested once more. Back in Denmark, they want to steal a railroad car full of gold bars to get their money back.

Title: 99. The Pinchcliffe Grand Prix
Description: Reodor Felgen decides that he will enter a car race to defeat his former friend who has stolen his plans for a car.

Title: 100. Autopsy
Description: A young pathology doctor interning in a morgue tries to cope with a wave of suicides. A woman she just met kills herself, but she suspects someone close to her might have killed her.
filming_locations: ['Autodromo di Vallelunga, Campagnano di Roma, Rome, Lazio, Italy']
